main event: On 14 December 1957, a civilian observed a red-hazy, round object, approximately six feet in diameter, brightening and dimming, with two bars 25 feet below the object resembling a wing span, in the sky 3 miles north-east of Albany, Oregon. The observation lasted for 2 hours and 28 minutes, and the object appeared to be stationary.
interesting points: The civilian reported a red-hazy, round object brightening and dimming, with two bars 25 feet below the object resembling a wing span.
The observation lasted for 2 hours and 28 minutes, indicating a prolonged sighting.
The object was reported as stationary, adding to the mystery of the sighting.
The report includes a hand-drawn sketch of the observed object.
The pilot, while scouring the area, reported seeing nothing except for a bright full moon on the horizon, leading to the possibility of a misinterpretation of the rising sun or a possible mirage.
sighted object: red-hazy, round object with two bars 25 feet below resembling a wing span
